Description: Glass amphoriskos. Body and handles clear dark green with opaque orange trails. Straight shoulder, sloping down to curved junction with body; elongated ovoid body with slightly convex sides tapering downward. Two small vertical ribbon-handles at top of body. On upper neck two revolutions of wavy zigzag; on body, starting on shoulder, a feather pattern; on each handle a single, central, vertical, unmarvered trail. Core-formed and tooled; trails on neck and body drawn on, marvered and combed, those on handles in sunken relief.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: BM Glass Murray et al. 1900, 23 f., fig. 63. Fossing 1940, 29 (mention only). Astrom 1967, 58f., 126 (=id. 1972, 530 f., 598). Nolte 1968, 112, 119, no. 42.
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (5)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 98)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.23,35, Fig 63)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (P. 153, Bottle No.1)
Condition: Parts of neck, shoulder, upper body, and handles extant, remainder restored in plaster. Broken and mended, two small gaps in upper body. Extensive strain-cracks. Whitish to brown enamel-like weathering in patches, beginning to flake away, leaving deeply pitted surface.
